alert.note: Alert for Copiah; Lawrence; Lincoln; Simpson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 12 at 7:58AM CST until January 12 at 8:45AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Simpson County in central Mississippi... Northeastern Lincoln County in south central Mississippi... Northern Lawrence County in south central Mississippi... Southeastern Copiah County in central Mississippi... * Until 845 AM CST. * At 758 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Wesson, or near Brookhaven, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Oma and Rockport around 825 AM CST. Shivers around 835 AM CST. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Beauregard and New Hebron. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for south central and central Mississippi. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
